title: Staff of Amunmose
description:
Curved wooden staff with single column of incised hieroglyphic text. The text records the staff is an “offering to Amun (by) the craftsman of the king’s daughter, Bkt’Imn, may she live, of Pa-ta-en-hut, ‘Imn-ms”.
Condition: Scratches, chips, and dents.
section: The Late Eighteenth Dynasty and the Ramesside Period

museum_location.name: 19th Dynasty to Roman Period, Martha A. and Robert S. Rubin Gallery, 3rd Floor

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.1830E
labels.content: The single column of text relates that this staff was an "offering to Amun by the craftsman of the Princess Baket-Amun, may she live, Amunmose."

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
